title: Taking Leave
opening: Once, dragon fought man in a war called the Scouring… Mankind vanquished the dragons thanks to the efforts of eight heroes. These eight mighty generals brought peace to Elibe. The continent was divided into nations, and the people enjoyed an easy prosperity. The hero Hartmut settled in the east and founded Bern, famed for its military might. St. Elimine moved west, and her sacred name flourished among the artisans of Etruria. The horseman Hanon’s legacy lived on with the nomads of his beloved plains of Sacae. The birthplace of the knight Barigan is now home to the renowned Knights of Ilia. The berserker Durban’s final glory was to create a warrior’s clan in the Western Isles. The archsage Athos is said to have retired to the barren wasteland of Nabata. The heirs of the champion Roland themselves became the lords of the Lycian League. Elibe has enjoyed a peace that spans 980 years…

How much longer can this peace stand before its foundations begin to crumble? Deep within the Lycian League lies Pherae, a land that has known no conflict for many generations, but which now finds itself touched by a shadow of unease. Its beloved and benevolent ruler, Lord Elbert, has mysteriously vanished… as have a number of his sworn men, loyal knights who serve at his side. A month has passed without word from the marquess. Rumors of his death abound. However, the marquess’s son believes his father lives, and he has vowed to find him. Marquess Pherae’s son, Eliwood: A red-haired youth who will one day become the finest knight in all of Lycia. His long journey begins here.

intro.speaker: Marcus
intro.line: Lord Eliwood, we leave on your word.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: I see. Thank you, Marcus.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Mother, it’s time for us to go.

intro.speaker: Eleanora
intro.line: Eliwood... Promise that you will return to me safely. I’m worried about your father, but... If anything were to happen to you... My heart could not bear that sorrow.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: I know, Mother. Please do not worry. Father is alive, I know it. I vow that I will find him and return him to your side.

intro.speaker: Eleanora
intro.line: I have your word then.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Yes, of course. Isadora, I entrust my mother to you in my absence.

intro.speaker: Isadora
intro.line: Yes, milord. I will guard over her well.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Mother, I will return. Rest easy.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Well, Marcus, it looks like it’s just the two of us.

intro.speaker: Marcus
intro.line: Not so, milord. My man Lowen will be traveling with us.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Lowen? That’s reassuring.

intro.speaker: Marcus
intro.line: I’ve sent him ahead to the village. He hopes to seek out a few able men who are skilled at arms. Normally, I wouldn’t venture forth without a larger company, but... I bow to your will on this matter, Lord Eliwood.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: I’m sorry, Marcus, but I would rather not deprive my mother of even a single guard. The best knights in the realm disappeared with my father. If anything were to happen to my mother while I am gone, I...

intro.speaker: Marcus
intro.line: I understand, milord. Hmph! What’s keeping Lowen!?

intro.speaker: Groznyi
intro.line: We’ve all heard that the knights of Pherae have vanished, right? Well, your misfortune is my good luck! I have an announcement to make! As of now, this village is mine! Groznyi is your new liege! Now bring every last piece of gold, down to the smallest fleck!

intro.speaker: Lowen
intro.line: Lord Eliwood! Co-Commander Marcus! I...

intro.speaker: Marcus
intro.line: Lowen! Calm yourself! A knight must be in control at all times.

intro.speaker: Lowen
intro.line: The village is under attack! It’s bandits!

intro.speaker: Marcus
intro.line: What? Bandits? Here!?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Are you sure, Lowen?

intro.speaker: Lowen
intro.line: This girl has more details.

intro.speaker: Rebecca
intro.line: My lord Eliwood? I’m the daughter of the village magistrate. My name’s Rebecca. The bandits came without warning. They’re stealing everything! I beg you! Please help us!

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: I see. Marcus! Lowen! We must aid the village!

intro.speaker: Lowen
intro.line: Yes, milord!

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Rebecca, stay here, and keep out of sight.

intro.speaker: Rebecca
intro.line: If it please you, milord, I would rather fight. I hunt almost every day, and I have some skill with a bow.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Is that so? Very well, but be careful!

intro.speaker: Rebecca
intro.line: Yes, milord.

intro.speaker: Lowen
intro.line: Lord Eliwood, one more thing. There is another in the village who has offered to help. A traveling tactician who was staying at the inn.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: A tactician?

intro.speaker: Lowen
intro.line: Yes, milord. This is Mark.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Mark!

intro.speaker: Lowen
intro.line: Do you know this person, milord?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Yes. I met Mark during the trouble in Caelin last year. A fantastic military advisor, if memory serves. If not for Mark, the marquess of Caelin and his granddaughter, Lyn, might not have survived Lundgren’s uprising. What brings you to Pherae, my friend? Ha! Still traveling about, honing your skills? Of course... A worthy pursuit. Let’s give thanks to providence for our chance reunion. We have need of your aid. Please lend us your skill.

battle.speaker: Bartre
battle.line: Look, Dorcas! Can you believe it? It’s just like that knight said! That’s Lord Eliwood!

battle.speaker: Bartre
battle.line: What’s he doing? Hey, he’s taking on those bandits. Protecting innocents? That’s a right lordly thing to do, isn’t it? Right, Dorcas?

battle.speaker: Dorcas
battle.line: You talk too much. The lordling needs our help.

battle.speaker: Bartre
battle.line: Right! Leave these mountain weaklings to me! I’m Bartre the Brave!

battle.speaker: Woman
battle.line: Is Lord Elbert well? We’ve heard nothing but foul rumors hereabouts... All of Pherae is worried for his well-being. We hear tell that Lord Eliwood is going to find the marquess. This dragon shield is our village treasure... It boosts the defenses of the one who uses it. Take it, please. And may it see you and Lord Elbert home safely.

battle.speaker: Man
battle.line: There’s a young traveler been stayin’ with the magistrate. Been stayin’ in the village for a few days now. I know, you’re thinkin’ it’s just another good-for-nothing courtier lookin’ for a handout. But there’s somethin’ more to this one... Those eyes... They miss nothing. Got a mission, that one has.

battle.speaker: Man
battle.line: You’ve got some skill with weapons, but do you understand weapon levels? The more you use a weapon, the more skilled you become. Still, you can only reach the highest level with a single weapon.

boss.speaker: Groznyi
boss.line: What is this, a pack of children coming to play? You think you can challenge me? What? Pheraen knights!? But that’s impossible!!!

boss.speaker: Groznyi
boss.line: Ugh... I thought my luck... was finally turning around...

end.speaker: Elder
end.line: Ah, you would be Lord Eliwood, yes? Our deepest thanks for coming to the aid of our fair village.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Think nothing of it. It’s a lord’s duty to protect the citizenry.

end.speaker: Elder
end.line: Would that were true, milord. The good folk of Laus know no such protection. Their marquess, Lord Darin, is too busy preparing for war. He ignores all complaints of bandits and thieves.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Preparing for war? Are you sure?

end.speaker: Elder
end.line: I would not lie, milord. My brother lived in Laus until a few days ago. His home was torched, and he had no choice but to flee here. According to him, Laus could go to war any day now. It’s all the people of Laus are talking about.

end.speaker: Marcus
end.line: Lord Eliwood, if this is true, the situation is a grave one. If Marquess Laus is readying for war... His target is most likely another Lycian territory. Perhaps this is connected to Lord Elbert’s disappearance.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: My father and Marquess Laus? It seems a tenuous connection, but it’s as good a start as any. Let us travel to Laus. We must learn more.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Thank you for your guidance, Mark. Where are you bound for next? If you have no destination in mind, perhaps you could travel with us. Ours is a small group, with a single purpose–to find my father. I do not know where our road will lead, but... We would be stronger with you in our company. You will travel with us? Splendid! Thank you! I pray we give you no cause to regret your decision.

end.speaker: Elder
end.line: Rebecca! Where do you think you’re going, young lady?

end.speaker: Rebecca
end.line: Father, I... I intend to accompany Lord Eliwood.

end.speaker: Elder
end.line: Don’t be ridiculous, girl! Lord Eliwood is not going on a picnic. He’s riding into danger.

end.speaker: Rebecca
end.line: I know that, Father. That’s why I want to go. We owe him our lives, and I want to repay him. My bow may not be all that much, but I know I can be of service!

end.speaker: Elder
end.line: But...

end.speaker: Rebecca
end.line: And, Father... I may meet up with my brother somewhere. You’re the magistrate–you have responsibilities. I... This is all I can offer. I need to do this! Please, Father! Let me go!

end.speaker: Elder
end.line: Dear me... You’re just as stubborn as your mother was.

end.speaker: Rebecca
end.line: I’m sorry, Father...

end.speaker: Elder
end.line: You must bow to Lord Eliwood’s wishes on this matter. If he consents, you may go.

end.speaker: Rebecca
end.line: Thank you, Father!

end.speaker: Elder
end.line: Lord Elbert has always been kind to us. Follow his son with a true heart, Rebecca. Serve Lord Eliwood well, as I have served his father.

end.speaker: Rebecca
end.line: I will, Father!
